service_description: This is a {{serverLink}} of {{imageWorkerLink}} and {{textWorkerLink}} by the volunteer organization {{haidraLink}}. If you like this service, consider helping us continue to make it possible by {{joinHordeLink}}!
more_information: For more information about the service, visit the {{faqLink}}. You can learn more about Haidra (the team behind it) at {{haidraLink}}, and you can also follow the {{developerBlogLink}} for the latest updates on features and our status. Have questions? Join our active {{discordLink}}!
latest_news.title: Latest news
latest_news.subtitle: Updates, announcements, and developments from the AI Horde community.
standard_images.tooltip.line2: Megapixelsteps = megapixels × steps. Steps are required for image generation and linearly increase the length of a job. For example, a 20 step job takes twice as long as a 10 step job.
standard_images.tooltip.line3: 1 standard image = megapixelsteps / 20 (assuming ~20 steps per typical image)
mps.tooltip.line2: Megapixelsteps = megapixels × steps. One megapixel equals a 1024×1024 image.
stats.total_pixelsteps.label: Total generated
stats.total_tokens.label: Total generated
stats.total_images.label: Total image requests fulfilled
stats.total_texts.label: Total text requests fulfilled
stats.total_alchemy_processed.label: Total processed
stats.active_workers.label: Active workers/threads
stats.image_queue.label: Queue
stats.text_queue.label: Queue
stats.interrogation_queue.label: Queue
stats.realtime: You can see the horde activity (including past stats) on {{grafanaLink}}
faq_subtitle: Find answers to common questions about AI Horde, from how it works to earning kudos and everything in between. For live help and discussions, join our {{discordLink}}!
quickstart.register_account: First register an account which will generate for you an API key. Store that key somewhere safe - treat it like a password.
quickstart.try_frontend_description: The easiest way to use AI Horde is through one of our user-friendly frontends. We recommend starting with ArtBot - a popular web-based client that's perfect for beginners.
quickstart.discord_cta_description: Join our {{discordLink}} - it's the best and most active place to ask questions, get support, and connect with the AI Horde community!
quickstart.anonymous_api_key: If you do not want to register, you can use {{anonymousApiKey}} as an API key to connect anonymously. However, anonymous accounts have the lowest priority when there are too many concurrent requests!
quickstart.explanation_api_key: To increase your priority you will need a unique API key and then to increase your Kudos. {{kudosExplanationLink}}
guis.description.horde_ng: HordeNG aims to be very simple to use for beginners, while allowing the full set of options for advanced users.
guis_page.title: AI Horde Frontends
guis_page.description: Explore our collection of user interfaces for generating images and text with AI Horde. Choose from web-based, desktop, and mobile applications to find the perfect tool for your needs.
guis_page.no_results: No frontends match your selected filters.
guis_and_tools_page.title: AI Horde GUIs and Tools
guis_and_tools_page.description: Explore our collection of user interfaces and developer tools for AI Horde. From web-based clients to desktop applications, mobile apps, SDKs, plugins, and bots - find everything you need to work with AI Horde.
guis_and_tools_page.intro_title: New to AI Horde? Here's what you'll find:
guis_and_tools_page.intro_paragraph_1: AI Horde is a community-powered network where volunteers share their computers to generate AI images and text for free.
guis_and_tools_page.intro_guis_desc: Easy-to-use applications for creating AI images and text. This includes web pages and mobile apps. Perfect if you just want to start making content.
guis_and_tools_page.intro_workers_desc: Software that lets you contribute your computer's power to help others. Earn kudos (priority points) by helping the community. Learn more in our FAQ.
guis_and_tools_page.intro_tools_desc: SDKs, libraries, and plugins for developers who want to integrate AI Horde into their own projects.
guis_and_tools_page.intro_paragraph_2: Most users start with a GUI/Frontend. We recommend ArtBot for beginners - it's web-based, so there's nothing to install. Use the filters below to find the perfect tool for your needs. Have questions? Check our FAQ.
guis_and_tools_page.worker_cta_title: Want to help power the Horde?
guis_and_tools_page.worker_cta_descripti: All the AI generation on this platform is provided by volunteers sharing their GPU power. Become a worker and earn kudos while helping make free AI accessible to everyone. Or, make a financial contribution to support the community.
guis_and_tools_page.no_results: No items match your selected filters.
tools_section_description: Discover developer tools, plugins, SDKs, and bots for AI Horde integration.
homepage.features.free_text: Powered by volunteers running open source software on their own hardware. Start generating now!
homepage.features.community_text: Join the Haidra community by becoming a worker and share your GPU power.
homepage.features.distributed_text: Harness the collective GPU power of volunteer workers for your generations.
homepage.features.nolockin_text: Use any compatible client or build your own with our open REST APIs.
homepage_guis.title: Frontends and Tools
homepage_guis.description: Access AI Horde through a variety of user-friendly interfaces and tools. From web browsers to desktop applications, mobile apps and SDKs, we offer multiple ways to generate images and text with AI. Browse our collection of frontends and tools to find the one that works best for you.
transfer.title: Transfer kudos
transfer.visit_old_pre: If you would like to log in using one of the account providers (Google, Discord, Github), you might need to use
transfer.visit_old_link_text: the old version of the transfer page
transfer.source_api_key.description: Type the API key that belongs to your user
invalid_api_key: The api key is not valid
transfer.kudos_amount.description: How many kudos do you want {{user}} to receive
transfer.success: The kudos have been successfully transferred!
transfer.error: There was an error while transferring the kudos, please try again later.
transfer.too_many_kudos: Eh, you don't have that many kudos
transfer.donate: or donate them to an educator account:
educators.explanation: Educator accounts are special accounts made available to teachers and educational institutions for classroom use of AI Horde.
profile.title: Profile
profile.login_description: Enter your API key to view your account information.
profile.no_auth_warning: Note: Your API key is only used to securely fetch your profile data and is stored locally in your browser.
profile.low_kudos_info_message: Running a worker is the best way to earn kudos! However, kudos are not required to use the horde - everyone can use it for free.
profile.no_workers_match_filters: No workers match the current filters.
profile.shared_keys.description: Create generation-only API keys to share your priority and kudos with friends and family—no separate accounts needed. Shared keys use your priority and kudos, can have optional limits and expiry dates, and cannot transfer kudos or perform other account operations.
profile.shared_keys.cache_notice: Changes can take up to 5 minutes to show due to server caching.
profile.shared_keys.none: You have no shared keys yet.
profile.shared_keys.name: Name
profile.styles.no_styles: You haven't created any styles yet
profile.styles.create_hint: Click the "Create Style" button to make your first style
profile.delete_account_warning_30_days: Deleting your account begins a 30-day grace period during which you can undo the deletion. After 30 days, you must confirm the deletion again to make it permanent.
profile.delete_account_warning_permanent: Warning: Your account has already been marked for deletion. If 30 days have passed since you initiated deletion, confirming now will permanently delete your account. This action cannot be undone.
profile.delete_account_enter_username: To confirm, enter your username below:
profile.delete_account_success: Your account has been marked for deletion.
profile.delete_account_permanent_success: Your account has been permanently deleted.
profile.account_marked_for_deletion_mess: Your account is currently marked for deletion. After 30 days from when you initiated deletion, you can permanently delete it. If you wish to keep your account, click the button below to restore it.
profile.undelete_account_message: Are you sure you want to restore your account? This will cancel the pending deletion.

admin.title: Admin Panel
admin.dashboard.title: Dashboard
admin.dashboard.moderator_description: As a moderator, you have access to additional tools for managing the horde.
admin.workers.title: Worker List
admin.workers.owner_not_found: No workers found for owner ID {{ownerId}}. The user may not have any active workers, or the ID may be incorrect.
admin.workers.filter_placeholder: Filter by name, owner, ID, or bridge agent...
admin.workers.sort.name: Name
admin.workers.button.maintenance_tooltip: The worker will remain online but won't accept any new jobs (finishing existing ones)
admin.workers.dialog.delete_warning_perm: Warning: This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
admin.workers.dialog.delete_warning_offl: Note: The worker must have been offline for more than 30 days for the deletion to be accepted by the API.
admin.workers.dialog.delete_error: Failed to delete worker. The worker may not have been offline for more than 30 days, or you may not have permission to delete it.
admin.workers.deletion_success: Worker deleted successfully! Note: It may take up to a minute for the API to reflect this change.
admin.users.title: User Management
admin.users.search_placeholder: Search by username or user ID...
admin.users.select_user: Enter a username or user ID to search.
admin.users.unsaved_changes: You have unsaved changes. Click 'Save Changes' to apply them.
admin.users.hint.proxy_passkey: Pass this to your proxy to authenticate requests.
admin.users.desc.moderator: Set to true to make this user a horde moderator.
admin.users.desc.trusted: When set to true, the user and their servers will not be affected by suspicion.
admin.users.desc.flagged: When set to true, the user cannot transfer kudos and all their workers are put into permanent maintenance.
admin.users.desc.public_workers: Set to true to make this user display their worker IDs.
admin.users.desc.customizer: When set to true, the user can serve custom Stable Diffusion models which do not exist in the Official AI Horde Model Reference.
admin.users.desc.service: When set to true, the user is considered a service account proxying the requests for other users.
admin.users.desc.education: When set to true, the user is considered an education account and some options become more restrictive.
admin.users.desc.special: When set to true, the user can send special payloads.
admin.users.desc.filtered: When set to true, the replacement filter will always be applied against this user.
admin.users.desc.vpn_access: When set to true, the user will be able to onboard workers behind a VPN (temporary until trusted).
admin.users.desc.worker_invites: Set to the amount of workers this user is allowed to join when in worker invite-only mode.
admin.users.desc.usage_multiplier: The amount by which to multiply the user's kudos consumption.
admin.users.desc.concurrency: The amount of concurrent requests this user can have.
admin.users.desc.monthly_kudos: When specified, will start assigning the user monthly kudos, starting now!
admin.users.desc.worker_count: How many workers this user has created (active or inactive).
admin.users.desc.evaluating_kudos: The amount of Evaluating Kudos this untrusted user has from generations and uptime.
admin.users.desc.kudos: The amount of Kudos this user has. The amount of Kudos determines request priority.
admin.users.desc.suspicious: How much suspicion this user has accumulated.
admin.users.desc.contact: Contact details for the horde admins to reach the user in case of emergency.
admin.users.desc.admin_comment: Information about this user added by the admins.
admin.users.styles.name: Name
admin.users.dialog.undelete_message: Are you sure you want to restore this user? This will cancel their pending deletion.
admin.common.error: An error occurred. Please try again.
admin.common.access_denied_message: You must be logged in to access this page.
admin.filters.title: Filter Management
admin.filters.search_placeholder: Search by regex, description, user, or ID...
admin.filters.form.regex_hint: Enter a valid regex pattern to match content.
admin.filters.form.replacement_hint: Leave empty to block without replacement.
admin.filters.dialog.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this filter? This action cannot be undone.
admin.filters.prompt_tester.title: Prompt Tester
admin.filters.prompt_tester.description: Test a prompt against all active filters to see if it would be blocked or flagged.
admin.filters.compiled_regex.description: These are the compiled regex patterns for each filter type. All individual filter patterns are combined into a single regex per type for efficient matching.
admin.operations.title: IP Operations
admin.operations.ip_timeouts.title: IP Timeout List
admin.operations.ip_timeouts.description: View and manage all currently blocked IP addresses and CIDR ranges.
admin.operations.add_ip.title: Add IP Timeout
admin.operations.add_ip.description: Block an IP address or CIDR range for a specified duration.
admin.operations.add_ip.ip_hint: Enter an IP address (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or CIDR range (e.g., 10.0.0.0/24)
admin.operations.check_ip.title: Check IP Status
admin.operations.check_ip.description: Check if a specific IP address or CIDR range is currently blocked.
admin.operations.check_ip.blocked_messag: This IP is blocked. Time remaining:
admin.operations.check_ip.not_blocked_me: This IP is not currently blocked.
admin.operations.worker_block.title: Block Worker IP
admin.operations.worker_block.descriptio: Block the IP address associated with a specific worker for a specified number of days.
admin.operations.worker_block.active_wor: Note: Only currently active workers are shown. This list does not include all registered workers.
admin.operations.worker_block.worker_pla: Search for a worker by name or ID...
admin.operations.dialog.delete_ip_confir: Are you sure you want to remove this IP timeout? The IP will be unblocked immediately.
admin.operations.dialog.refresh_ip_confi: This will extend the timeout duration for this IP address.
admin.operations.dialog.block_worker_con: Are you sure you want to block this worker's IP address? This will prevent the worker from connecting to the horde.
admin.operations.dialog.unblock_worker_c: Are you sure you want to remove the IP block for this worker?
details.leaderboard.title: Kudos Leaderboard
details.leaderboard.appreciation_title: Thank You to Our Top Contributors!
details.leaderboard.appreciation_message: These generous individuals have accumulated kudos by running workers and contributing their computing power to the AI Horde community. Their dedication and generosity make free AI generation possible for everyone. We are deeply grateful for their ongoing support!
details.leaderboard.kudos_explanation_1: Kudos are the priority currency of AI Horde—earned by running workers that process generation requests for the community. Users with more kudos get faster queue times, but kudos never expire and cannot be sold for money.
details.leaderboard.kudos_explanation_2: High kudos balances represent individuals who have contributed far more computing power to the community than they have consumed. These are the backbone of the volunteer network—people who keep the horde running by consistently providing GPU power so that anyone can generate AI images and text for free.
details.leaderboard.learn_more_faq: Learn more about kudos in our FAQ →
details.leaderboard.footer_note: Kudos can be freely gifted between users but cannot be exchanged for money. Running a worker is the primary way to earn kudos and help the community.
details.leaderboard.find_my_rank_descrip: Discover where you stand among all AI Horde contributors.
details.leaderboard.thank_you_message: Thank you for being part of the AI Horde community!

joining.title: Join the Horde
joining.subtitle: Become a worker and help power the world's largest free, open-source AI generation network. Your GPU can make a difference.
joining.mission.title: Our Mission
joining.mission.description: The AI Horde is a non-profit, community-driven project committed to democratizing access to AI technologies. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to use generative AI, regardless of their financial means or technical resources. This service relies entirely on volunteer workers like you to make this vision a reality.
joining.why_workers.title: Why We Need Workers
joining.why_workers.description: Unlike commercial AI services that rely on expensive cloud infrastructure, the AI Horde is powered entirely by volunteers who share their computing resources. Every image generated, every text completed—it all happens because generous community members donate their GPU power. Without workers, there is no Horde. Your contribution directly enables thousands of people worldwide to access AI generation for free.
joining.worker_types.title: Choose Your Worker Type
joining.worker_types.image.title: Image Generation
joining.worker_types.image.description: Generate stunning AI images using Stable Diffusion, SDXL, Flux, and other image models. Image workers are in high demand and earn kudos quickly.
joining.worker_types.image.regen_desc: Official image worker with ComfyUI backend, supporting all major image models
joining.worker_types.text.title: Text Generation
joining.worker_types.text.description: Power text generation using Large Language Models (LLMs). Help users with creative writing, conversations, and more.
joining.worker_types.text.koboldcpp_desc: Fast, easy-to-use LLM backend with GGUF model support
joining.worker_types.text.aphrodite_desc: High-performance inference engine optimized for throughput
joining.worker_types.text.bridge_note: These backends connect to the Horde via the
joining.benefits.title: Why Become a Worker?
joining.benefits.earn_kudos.title: Earn Kudos
joining.benefits.earn_kudos.description: Accumulate kudos for every generation you process. Use them for priority access or leave them unspent to help the community.
joining.benefits.community.title: Join the Community
joining.benefits.community.description: Be part of a global movement democratizing AI access. Connect with like-minded enthusiasts on Discord.
joining.benefits.utilize_idle.title: Utilize Idle Resources
joining.benefits.utilize_idle.descriptio: Put your GPU to work when you're not using it. Convert idle computing power into community value.
joining.getting_started.title: Getting Started
joining.getting_started.step1.title: Register an Account
joining.getting_started.step1.descriptio: Create an account at aihorde.net to get your API key. This key identifies your worker and tracks your earned kudos.
joining.getting_started.step2.title: Choose Your Worker Software
joining.getting_started.step2.descriptio: Select the appropriate worker software based on whether you want to generate images or text. Follow the setup guides in the respective repositories.
joining.getting_started.step3.title: Configure Your Worker
joining.getting_started.step3.descriptio: Enter your API key, select which models you want to serve, and configure your preferences. The worker software includes detailed configuration guides.
joining.getting_started.step4.title: Start Contributing
joining.getting_started.step4.descriptio: Launch your worker and start earning kudos! Join our Discord community for support, tips, and to connect with other workers.
joining.cta.title: Ready to Make a Difference?
joining.cta.description: Join our Discord community to get help setting up your worker, share your experiences, and become part of the AI Horde family.
joining.alternative_support.title: Not able to run a worker?
joining.alternative_support.description: If you don't have a compatible GPU or can't run a worker, you can still support the AI Horde through
contribute.title: Contribute to AI Horde
contribute.subtitle: Whether you contribute computing power, development efforts, or financial support, all contributions make a difference.
donate.intro.title: Support Our Infrastructure
donate.intro.description: The AI Horde relies on volunteer computing power, but we also have infrastructure costs that require financial support. Your donation helps keep the service running smoothly for everyone.
donate.what_supports.title: What Your Donation Supports
donate.what_supports.description: All donations go directly toward maintaining and improving the AI Horde infrastructure:
donate.what_supports.servers.title: Server Costs
donate.what_supports.servers.description: API servers, databases, and backend infrastructure that coordinate the network
donate.what_supports.development.title: Development
donate.what_supports.development.descrip: Ongoing development and improvements to the platform and tools
donate.what_supports.community.title: Community
donate.what_supports.community.descripti: Resources and tools to support our growing community of users and workers
donate.ways_to_donate.title: Ways to Donate
donate.ways_to_donate.patreon.title: Patreon
donate.ways_to_donate.patreon.descriptio: Become a monthly supporter on Patreon
donate.ways_to_donate.patreon.kudos_note: Patrons receive monthly kudos as a thank-you for their support!
donate.ways_to_donate.kofi.title: Ko-fi
donate.ways_to_donate.kofi.description: Make a one-time or recurring donation on Ko-fi
donate.transparency.title: Transparency
donate.transparency.description: The AI Horde is a non-profit project run entirely by volunteers. All donations go directly toward infrastructure costs and platform development. Our code is completely open source, and we are committed to keeping the service free for everyone. We are registered in Luxembourg as a non-profit association (Haidra A.S.B.L.) and are forbidden from making a profit.
donate.alternatives.title: Other Ways to Help
donate.alternatives.description: Financial donations aren't the only way to support AI Horde. If you have a compatible GPU, consider running a worker to contribute computing power directly to the network.
volunteer_cta.message: The workers and models you see here are provided by generous volunteers. Please consider becoming a worker or donating to support the community.
